title: Authentic Russian Salad 'Olivye' Recipe
description: Authentic Russian salad recipe, aka olivye, made with boiled potatoes, carrot, and eggs mixed with pickles, ham, and peas in a mayonnaise dressing.
body: ​ Skip to content Allrecipes Search Please fill out this field. Search the site Please fill out this field. About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes Salad Potato Salad Recipes Dairy-Free Potato Salad Recipes Authentic Russian Salad 'Olivye' 4.8 (32) 24 Reviews 8 Photos This Russian salad recipe is what my mom and grandmother make every time there's a family gathering or a special occasion. Leave out the ham to make this a vegetarian dish. The potatoes, carrots, and eggs do not have to be completely chilled after boiling. Submitted by lovefullofpie Updated on April 8, 2024 Save Rate Print Share Add Photo 8 8 8 8 Prep Time: 30 mins Cook Time: 20 mins Total Time: 50 mins Servings: 10 Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 10 servings 6 potatoes, peeled 1 carrot, or more to taste 4 whole eggs 6 large pickles, cut into cubes 1 (15 ounce) can peas, drained ½ cup cubed fully cooked ham, or to taste 1 tablespoon chopped fresh dill, or to taste (optional) ½ cup mayonnaise, or to taste Directions Gather all ingredients. Bring a large pot of water to a boil. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Add potatoes, bring to a boil, and cook for 5 to 10 minutes. Add carrots and whole eggs and continue boiling until potatoes are tender, 10 to 15 minutes. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Drain and slightly cool mixture. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Chop potatoes and carrot. Peel and chop eggs. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Mix potatoes, carrot, eggs, pickles, peas, ham, and dill together in a large bowl. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Stir in mayonnaise until salad is evenly coated. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Recipe Tip You can use fresh parsley as a substitute for the dill if preferred. I Made It Print 79 home cooks made it! Your daily values may be higher or lower depending on your calorie needs. ** Nutrient information is not available for all ingredients. Amount is based on available nutrient data. If you are following a medically restrictive diet, please consult your doctor or registered dietitian before preparing this recipe for personal consumption. Add Your Photo Photos of Authentic Russian Salad 'Olivye' 01 of 08 Photo by  Dotdash Meredith Food Studios 02 of 08 Photo by  Joy 04/23/2020 03 of 08 Photo by  Sherrie Perez 02/19/2020 04 of 08 Photo by  Jennifer Richard-Souther 09/13/2018 05 of 08 Photo by  Jennifer Korpak Bechtel 04/01/2018 Turned out perfectly! Brought to book club for Russian themed night, and was asked for the recipe — everyone loved it. I used Yukon gold potatoes boiled for about 20 min., used frozen green peas (thawed), and half-mayonnaise half-sour cream for dressing. I used chopped fresh dill and seasoned with salt and pepper. I also chopped a shallot for a little more flavor. Family loved it, too. 06 of 08 Photo by  Paula Djuric 09/27/2017 Made this for my husband for his birthday, I found your recipe and this was the first time I made it. We were just back from our trip in slovenia and he said it was just like that! Thank you so much! It was soooo good!!! 9/26/17 Paula 07 of 08 Photo by  Jokaley 09/19/2016 08 of 08 Photo by  Sergiy Dementyev 12/31/2015 1 You’ll Also Love Russian Potato Salad 35 Ratings Russian Salmon and Potato Salad 32 Ratings My Mom's Good Old Potato Salad 124 Ratings Tangy Potato Salad 14 Ratings Lela's Fourth of July Potato Salad 12 Ratings Argentinean Potato Salad 31 Ratings Classic American-Style Potato Salad 107 Ratings Hawaiian Bruddah Potato Mac (Macaroni) Salad 47 Ratings My Grandma's Anise Potato Salad 6 Ratings Ensalada Rusa 19 Ratings Russian Beet and Potato Salad 51 Ratings Quick Potato Salad 24 Ratings Southern Potato Salad 720 Ratings Mom's Russian Potato Salad 4 Ratings Barbeque Potato Salad 34 Ratings Dad's Potato Salad 2 Ratings Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices   Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith publishing family.
